alert.note: Alert for Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 4:20PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Madison, northern Franklin, central Crawford, northwestern Sebastian, southeastern Washington and southeastern Sequoyah Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 420 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Marble to near Roland. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Mountainburg... Alma... Roland... Mulberry... Dyer... Chester... Moffett... St. Paul... Rudy... Cass... Saint Paul... Kingston... Aurora... Boston... Pettigrew... Japton... Lake Fort Smith... Witter... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 23. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 322 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Arkansas...and southeastern and east central Oklahoma.
